page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY MOELFRE
page.content: {Two retired sea captains interviewed. We went to the Llanallgo School that closed in 1977.We walked about a mile from the village along a track, the present road was built on it in 1922. Moelfre did not change a lot between 1800-1945, then it grew slowly. After 1962 it grew quickly when the Wylfa Power Station was built. Until 1933 Moelfre had a busy herring fishing industry a railway station was built in Benllech to carry the catch in barrels to Manchester.Suddenly the shoals of herring stopped coming and the fishermen had to find other ways of making a living.Before then many lived on smallholdings,they made their own nets and pickled the herring for their own use. Peter Walker & Sion Richards.
